item.description:
The Boston Israel Cleantech Alliance is proud to co-sponsor this conference featuring Congressman Ed Markey and executives from cleantech companies engaged in cross-border R&D, investments and business development in the United States and Israel.

There is no fee to attend this conference, but space is limited. To attend, you must register online at http://www.cjp.org/se... You may also RSVP to Beth at CJP at 617-457-8542 or bethrk@cjp.org


Agenda:

09:30am Registration opens

10:00-10:45 Networking Breakfast

10:45-11:15 Opening Remarks by:

  • Donna Kalikow, Executive Director of Center for Public Leadership (HKS)
  • Steven Grossman, former Chair, Democratic National Committee
  • Michael Granoff, Head of Oil Independence Policies at Better Place and President of Maniv Energy Capital



11:15-12:00 Keynote Address by Congressman Edward Markey (D-MA), co-author of the American Clean Energy and Security Act of 2009


12:00-1:00pm Panel Discussion, featuring:

  • Ric Fulop, Founder and VP of Business Development of A123 Systems
  • William Frey, CEO of Qteros
  • David Anthony, Managing Partner of 21Ventures
  • Amit Nisenbaum, Global Operations and Strategy Manager at Better Place



1:00-1:15pm Closing Remarks by George Bachrach, President of the Environment League of Massachusetts


Thank you to our co-sponsors: Combined Jewish Philanthropies, Goodwin Procter LLP, Environmental League of Massachusetts, Center for Public Leadership at Harvard Kennedy School, Harvard Kennedy School Israel Caucus, Harvard Business School Greentech & Sustainability Club.
item.name: Jumpstarting the Cleantech Economy through International Partnerships
